Basics

Every Euclase program starts off with one object, named root, as you can see below. Objects may have fields. Right now, root has none.

You can add a field by pressing the (Add field) button. This will show a list of field types:

  • Property: A field that can hold a value
  • Object: An object with state (we'll talk more about this later)

The current value for every field is shown in a yellow box to the right of the property's name

try adding a property to root:

When you add a field, its name appears on the far left hand side. To rename the field, you can click its name, enter a new name, and press [enter] (or [esc] to cancel).

To delete the field, give it an empty name

Use [ctrl]+z and [ctrl]+[shift]+z to undo and redo any changes you make to your program.
